'''Ekiga''' /i k ai g a/ (formerly called '''GnomeMeeting''') is a [[VoIP]] and [[video conferencing]] application for [[GNOME]] and [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. It is distributed as [[free software]] under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]]. It was the default VoIP client in [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] until October 2009, when it was replaced by [[Empathy (software)|Empathy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Ekiga|title=Ekiga|date=2008-10-23|publisher=Ubuntu Documentation|accessdate=2009-04-13}}</ref> Ekiga supports both the [[Session Initiation Protocol|SIP]] and [[H.323]] (based on [[Open Phone Abstraction Library|OPAL]]) protocols and is fully interoperable with any other SIP compliant application and with [[Microsoft]] [[NetMeeting]]. It supports many high-quality audio and video [[codec]]s.<ref name=What>{{cite web|url=http://wiki.ekiga.org/index.php/About_Ekiga|title=About Ekiga|date=23 February 2007|publisher=Ekiga Wiki|accessdate=2009-04-13}}</ref>
Ekiga was initially written by [[Damien Sandras]] in order to graduate from the [[UniversitÃ© catholique de Louvain]]. It is currently developed by a community-based team led by Sandras. The logo was designed based on his concept by Andreas Kwiatkowski.<ref name=Kwiatkowski>{{cite web|url=http://wiki.ekiga.org/index.php/People|title=People|date=23 February 2007|publisher=Ekiga Wiki|accessdate=2009-04-13}}</ref>
Ekiga.net also serves as a free and private SIP registrar, which enables its members to originate and terminate (receive) calls from and to each other without involvement of any other networks (such as the [[Public switched telephone network|PSTN]]) except the Internet.
== Features == Ekiga's website states that the features include:<ref name=Features>{{cite web|url=http://wiki.ekiga.org/index.php/Features|title=Features|date=27 September 2008|publisher=Ekiga Wiki|accessdate=2009-04-13}}</ref>
=== Integration === * [[Lightweight Directory Access Protocol|LDAP]] directories registration and browsing * Integration with [[Novell Evolution]] so that contacts are shared between both programs * [[ZeroConf]] ([[Bonjour (software)|Apple Bonjour]]) support * External configuration with [[GConf]], including ability for administrators to block certain settings * Device auto-detection, including: ** [[USB]] hotplug support. ** [[ALSA (Linux)|ALSA]] and legacy [[Open Sound System|OSS]] soundcard support, through plugins ** [[Video4linux]] and [[FireWire camera]] support, through plugins
=== User interface === * [[Contact list]] based interface * [[SIMPLE|Presence]] support with custom message * Monitoring of contacts (in call, online, offline, â¦) * Call history * Dialpad * Addressbook * Chat window * [[Session Initiation Protocol|SIP]] [[Uniform Resource Locator|URL]]s and [[H.323]]/callto * Full-screen videoconferencing (accelerated using the graphic card) * In call Instant-Apply support for settings
=== Technical features === * [[Call forwarding]] on busy, no answer, always (SIP and H.323) * [[Call transfer]] (SIP and H.323) * Call hold (SIP and H.323) * [[Dual-tone multi-frequency|DTMF]] support (SIP and H.323) * Basic instant messaging (SIP) * Text chat (SIP and H.323) * Register with several registrars (SIP) and gatekeepers (H.323) simultaneously * Ability to use an outbound proxy (SIP) or a gateway (H.323) * [[Message Waiting Indicator|Message waiting indications]] (SIP) * Audio and video (SIP and H.323) * [[STUN]] support (SIP and H.323) * [[Lightweight Directory Access Protocol|LDAP]] support * Audio codec algorithms: [[iLBC]], [[GSM 06.10]], [[MS-GSM]], [[G.711]] A-law, G.711 Âµ-law, [[G.726]], [[G.721]], [[Speex]], [[G.722]], [[CELT]] (also [[G.723.1]], [[G.728]], [[G.729]], [[GSM 06.10]], [[GSM-AMR]], [[G.722.2]] [GSMâ[[AMR-WB]]] using [[Intel]] [[Integrated Performance Primitives|IPP]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ippcodecs.org/|title=OPAL Plug-In for Intel Integrated Performance Primitives|publisher=Vox Lucida|accessdate=2009-04-13}}</ref> * Video codec algorithms: [[H.261]], [[H.263]]+, [[H.264]], [[Theora]], [[MPEG-4]]<ref>[http://www.ekiga.org/index.php?rub=2 Ekiga Current Features], Retrieved on 2009-07-09</ref>
